content:
26, 2014
												I think this actually was the first PC game that I have ever played (well apart from those pre-installed games on Windows XP like Solitaire). I enjoyed it back in the days. I still do.Disciples II is a turn-based strategy game with beautiful graphics (even for today) and rich storyline. Unlike other turn-based strategy titles like Heroes, the battle system offers a control over individual units instead of stacked units, which I find very convenient. Also the different strategies you can use to complete a map and the rich storyline guarantees that the gameplay does not get repetitive as it is with Heroes of Might and Magic.In Disciples II, you get to choose from five different races (Elves, Humans, Dwarfes, Demons and Undeads) with their own unique agendas and characteristics. Also you can choose one of three classes for yourself as a strategist: Mage (cast spells twice a day), Warlord (restore Health more quickly) or Guildmaster (more resources and actions for the Thief). So when you've completed game with one race/leader class you can try another.This game offers three elements of gaming experience that I value the most: great style, rich storyline and character development/customization. Also, this game rewards exploring and there are plenty of quest maps to try after the campaign mode is complete.What I didn't like about this game however was that you can export only one leader and only five items to the next campaign, so lot of valuable equipment is lost in the process. Also I didn't like that only a particular development branch could be chosen for a unit class instead of them all. Also, the Multiplayer via Directplay does not work anymore. I guess, you need to try external services like GameRanger for that.Nevertheless, Disciples II is a great classic turn-based strategy game. My overall rating is 10/10.p.s. Don't believe other reviews. This game works on Windows 8.1 like a charm. I had some issues with fullscreen on my laptop (I had to choose a lower resolution, otherwise the game won't fit the screen), but with external monitor there are no problems at all.

number of helpful: 15 of 19 people (79%) found this review helpful
content:
er 28, 2016
												Such an amazing game. The Legend! Somewhere close to the HoMM on that turn-based-strategy Olympus. The core features of this game - amazing visuals and simplified strategy part, countless hours of fun!++Visuals - beautiful character arts, cool mobs models, brutal heroes and colorful landscapes - everything perfectly mixed to create an amazing feeling of a magical journey to the land of Elves and Demons! Even in 2k16, this game still looks gorgeous, despite the fact that there is no hi-res (So i would recommend using old square ELT monitor for the better experience)++Soundwork - 10/10 OST, amazing sound effects and what's more important - 11/10 voice over - seriously this game is the best example of how to make the perfect game.+Great campaigns - All the campaigns - humans, demons, undeads, elves or dwarves are equally interesting, and what's more important, you export your hero from one scenario to another, and this feature saved even in a single! or multi!player - means you can take your hero through the countless battles, and complete harder and harder missions over time! Or you can battle your friends over and over again, exporting your best hero, so you will have more and more intense battles every time.+Nonlinear units leveling system - means you can try various strategies with every faction, there is no PERFECT build, you have to find the one that fits you.+Intense hot-seat sessions - such a great party game, you can play with your friends or your girlfriend, a single game can take HOURS to be completely finished, yet you can finish the game pretty quick - once you lose your main army over some stupid mistake for example :0 Some personal suggestions in the end - for a better experience, try to find an old machine to play this gem - this game has its problems on new computers, yet they are fixable - fps issues, screen resolution etc - everything is fixable up to win10.2 - for the better multiplayer experience I would suggest that small mod, that enables leadership 5 on all level 1 heroes (except thieves and other heroes that supposed to have leadership 1) that makes the game more dynamic, faster start and stuff.

y 17, 2014
												Hi! I am Muzday! Listen: if you haven't played this game so far, you had lost a lot of fun! Okay, not fun but a lot of gothic.  It impregnates every part of this game: from the design of cities till the soundtrack. I can say with certainty that this game has a strange magical atmosphere, it absorbs all your attention and makes you spend several hours in front of your screen per day, ending turns, fighting the battles with their unique style and develop your squads as you want. After you begin playing, you will notice that you are ready to stroke your soldiers like favourite pets if it will make them to beat enemies more precisely! In general, the only thing I can tell about this game is: If you are looking for a classic and unusual strategy game with a wonderful design, gloomy soundtrack, unrepeatable gothic atmosphere and five different playable races, this game is for you and it is worth your attention!P.S.My first review =)

number of helpful: 11 of 12 people (92%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
1, 2015
												This game as well as the game previous it are both very good. It is a turn based strategy that has many fun features. The story and lore is actually really good and makes logical sense, so that is also nice. I don't have to much to say about this game, so lets go ahead with the pros and cons list.Pros-Good Story/Lore, I enjoyed playing the campaigns through, and they are all very nice.Difficulty, it isn't to hard playing it on normal, but playing it on hard can be a bit rough.Combat, much like Disciples 1, this game has a unique combat style, somewhat like a turn based. The combat is fun and I don't get the repetative boredom effect after playing this game a lot.Music/Audio, the music is very good, very rememberable.Tutorial, the tutorial is actually pretty good, unlike other games like these. The tutorial doesn't feel intrusive but also provides you the information you need to properly play the game, which is nice.Cons-Graphics, although the game itself is dated, which I understand, some of the graphics themselves don't look very good. I can't say to many bad things about them, they have really good points as well.Repetativeness, the game can be seen as repetative after a while, especially if you are having a hard time getting past a certain stage.Time, the stages actually take quite a bit of time, but I guess that is why they have the save function. One problem I have is I would prefer to start and finish something in one sitting, so this may or may not be a problem for you.Conclusion-Overall, I really enjoy this game. It is similar to the Might&Magic series, but personally I think that Disciples has a much better story. I believe that the lore in video games is almost as important as the game itself, I guess that is the Game Master in me. Anyway, Disciples II: Rise of the Elves is definitely a fun game that I highly recommend.May your adventures be many and always end in reward!-Donoknight, Founder of Tabletop RPG Gamers League

content:
12, 2014
												Okay so, I'd like to address a big issue I've seen in a lot of the comments, which is that if you have a Windows 7 that this game will not work for you, that's not true. However: the game may not boot up properly all the time, leaving it just a dark screen and you needing to CTL+ALT+Delete and close the game and try and reopen it again. Alright. The game it's self is a lot of fun, the design and themes make up a lot of the appeal. The gameplay it's self is still very fun if you enjoy turn-based fighting, though it's not terribly unique in the combat area. It's a lot of fun to level up your units and build your structures to choose the path your units level up into. There are 5 races to play, and if you've come across Disciples II: Gallean's Return on here I don't recommend buying that because this game is the same game but with more content and it's the same price. I made the mistake of buying both this game and that game (though thankfully they're cheap games). Edit: The game also comes with an EXTREMELY versatile level editor. You can make your own quests or campaigns and involve advanced AI and events with extremely intricate triggers and it is REALLY easy to do so.

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
er 29, 2016
												Note: the review below is about the gameplay itself. Prior to that, I'd like to bring your attention to the issues that I had with running this game on Windows 7. It is working fairly stable now, but only after tinkering around for a while and disabling the sound completely. Everything might work smoothly out-of-the-box, but be aware that it also might not.Whenever I come back to this game, it sucks me in for hours on end. It has this classic quality that makes me completely lose track of time, and if you're interested at all in turned-based strategy games with tactical combat, this is a game for you.Of course the graphics are outdated, but I think it still works pretty well because of its very enjoyable art style. That being said, I don't know what kind of experience you'll have if you didn't play the game during its initial release.In many ways, the game is very similar to the Heroes of Might and Magic series, although the style of the tactical combat is different. The gameplay boils down to: Roaming around the map with your hero and his party, battling orcs, wild animals, dragons and other players' parties in between, while developing your capital and other cities and claiming as much of the terrain for yourself as possible in order to increase resource income.In conclusion: Just play the damn game. It's cheap, it's fun, it's great.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 13, 2012
												Fantastic HoMM-style turn-based strategy RPG built around Norse mythology marred by some poor game design choices. There's great variety between the races and each has their own campaign, with each faction having a distinct style. The combat is unique and feels like Ogre Battle but this is also one of it's biggest problems; similarly to Ogre Battle, if all of your units in a party die, they are gone forever. Your favorite hero and his units will transfer between missions so this means if one of your super-units dies you can potentially throw the campaign. The terrain control mechanic is a great visual representation of your area control but I find it downplayed in many missions because of a turn limit or boss rush. Hero customization is diverse and has more options than HoMM but they are slower to level up. Although it has aged poorly, this is a great HoMM alternative that is worth checking out if you're a fan of strategy games.

content:
y 2
												When I was shown this game by someone back in highschool, I never stopped playing it.I have been a Disciples fan for well over 10 years now and I have no intention of stopping.I own the hard copy of Disciples II Gold so I was alittle dissapointed that that version was not on Steam concidering that it is the deffinitive version.  I however was very pleased to find Rise of the Elves avalible.One thing to keep in mind however is it is a bit borked at first, there are forum posts that help fix the issue, otherwise it runs perfectly.This is the most polished game I have ever seen, over a decade of playing and I personally have only ever encountered one bug, and it was purely graphical which was fixed by a simple reinstall (hard disk).  The digital version so far no bug to be seen, so it was potentially a hardware issue from my old potato computer XDThe only Exception is the Seals quest for the Legion, when fighting the first guardian you will be spammed to death with a fire spell, you need to use cheats to get past it alive.Disciples II has aged suprisingly well, for really early 3d graphics and isometric pixle .gifs this game still looks great...ish xD. All the units are recognizable and its easy to see whats going on, although some of the animations are questionable :pMechanicly this game is very well balanced, although the Undead Hords of Mortis are alittle op, but thats why they are fun.Hords:Difficulty to play : MediumDifficulty to level : HardDifficulty to Build : Hard/EasyMax Teir unit Strength: Very StrongFaction Trait: Potentially Strongest end Teir units/Unique passivesAverage Playstyle: Manipulate/Blitz/SupportMountain Clans:Difficulty to play : EasyDifficulty to level : MediumDifficulty to Build : Medium/HardMax Teir unit Strength: Strong/MediumFaction Trait: Strong end Teir units/Variety of specilized unitsAverage Playstyle: Fortify/Brawl/SupportHoly Empire:Difficulty to play : Medium/EasyDifficulty to level : Medium/HardDifficulty to Build : Medium/HardMax Teir unit Strength: StrongFaction Trait: Variety of specilized units/Dedicated HealersAverage Playstyle: Support/OutliveElven Alliance:Difficulty to play : EasyDifficulty to level : MediumDifficulty to Build : MediumMax Teir unit Strength: Strong/MediumFaction Trait: Elemental Healers/Strongest ranged units (go figure)Average Playstyle: Fortify/SnipeLegions of the Dammed:Difficulty to play : HardDifficulty to level : Medium/HardDifficulty to Build : Easy/Medium/HardMax Teir unit Strength: Strong/Medium/Da ♥♥♥♥ is this?Faction Trait: High HP pools/Unique ability based units/Best Direct Offensive UnitsAverage Playstyle: Blitz/ManipulateThe story of this game is also fantastic, the main "hero" of this game is actually Bethrezen if you know the lore, kind of an inturesting turn of events to have the Devil archytype character be the actuall good guy in this universe.  All the stories are interconnected and flow very well.I love this game.I would really like to see this game rebuilt in HD since the flop that was Disciples III destroyed the franchise I doubt a Disciples IV will ever come to pass.

y 11
												At startup itd det the resolution exceptionally small and the opening menu was super laggy. I couldn't click any of the menu buttons either. The only input it took was ESC. Hitting ESC brought up a prompt asking if I wanted to close the current game. However I couldn't say yes, because I couldn't click anything and no there was no hotkey I could find. Windows Key + D brought up the Windows taskbar, but wouldn't minimize the game. I could open the task manager with Shift + CTRL + ESC. But I couldn't see it, because the game refused to minimize. I had to right click the task manager icon in the system tray and select Always On Top. This brought the task manager to the forefront so I could make the game forcefully close.10/10 had a blast

content:
3, 2015
												Disciples II continues the Disciples II saga. The changes are just what you would expect. A new campaign playing as the elves with the appropriate capital, buildings, units and spells. If you haven't played a Disciples game before I highly recommend playing Sacred Lands and Disciples II first as it will give you greater context for the world and the races in it. If you have played the other games you know what to expect already. Disciples II: Rise of the Elves doesn't do anything particularly new but expands on an already solid formula. Richly detailed artwork and music help to immerse you in a dark fantasy world. If you are a Disciples fan this is a worthwhile addition to the series and one that ultimately gives you more of what you love.

content:
, 2015
												Excluding my thoughts on the gameplay itself: This game is incredibly hard to get working on windows 7 and newer. It's possible, just be prepared to trouble shoot for an hour or twoThe game itself: Absolutely wonderful. It's a HUGE time sink. Very basic turn based strategy. Very easy for new players, very challenging for experienced players. The game does lack a bit of overall strategy though and relies a bit on steamrolling the map with one or two parties, and can be a bit "grindy" in the first 20 turns.  Still recommend it's really addicting.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
er 25, 2011
												The best and ending chapter of the epic Disciples II saga, probably the best turn-based strategy game ever released. As the title suggests, the campaign focuses on the newly introduced faction of the Elves, aided by their centaur allies. Which side will you choose to further the interests of the Elves? The Noble Elves or the Wild Elves?Regardless of your choice in troops, you'll be fighting epic battles against very powerful enemies that will trully test your skills.The graphics are mostly 2D, and while most of you will take that as a very bad sign, trust me when I say that the artistic style and attention to each and every line makes this a very good looking game still.The music is breathtaking and sound is overall very well made. Make no mistake, the atmosphere is dark and gloomy, but also glorious and uplifting.Make sure you get Disciples II Gold Edition which includes the original game as well as all the (three) expansion packs.
